result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine E Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jermaine E Washington is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jermaine E Washington was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Jermaine E Washington was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Jermaine E Washington was found guilty of Attempt Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution of $300.00 to Fay H.; $1,100.00 to Medford R.; and $1,045.00 to Pame V.  
EACH COUNT:  Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements secondary to restitution.
Monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would then be paid while on Extended Supervision.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment and/or school at least 40 hours a week.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
NO use, possession or sale/delivery of illegal drugs or possession of drug paraphernalia.
No contact with coactors E.W. and Owens., or victims
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Practice absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended supervison apply to all counts.

superTimeConds.notes: In the Sherman Park area.  Not near the victims or coactors E.W. AND Owens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count seven.  Credit for 148 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 15.  Credit for 148 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine E Washington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (43 pages) commencing 09/03/2015 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
Community Impact Statement, received and filed.

--Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, received and filed.
--Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, received and filed.
--Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Defendant Jermaine E Washington in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Jermaine E Washington in custody.  
Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Amended Information filed on today.  The Court modifies the Amended Information so that Count 5 now reads as Count 19 to remain consistent with criminal complaint which names co-defendant Matthew Owens only as to Count 5.  

COUNT 19:  ATTEMPT BURGLARY (BUILDING OR DWELLING)- PTAC, AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.10(1m)(a), 939.50(3)(f), 939.32, 939.05, a Class F Felony

Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 7, 15, AND 19 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea as to Counts 7 and 15.  The state sets forth factual basis to sustain the plea as to Count 19; defense stipulates.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

AS TO COUNTS 1, 9, 11, AND 17 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion the Court orders the aforementioned counts DISMISSED OUTRIGHT WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  The Court orders the defendant REMANDED at this time.  Case remains set for Sentencing Hearing on 9-03-15 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 30.
Victim impact statements (x2) and Restitution Worksheets (x2), received and filed.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer appears by telephone, Defendant Jermaine E Washington not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment.  The Court adjourned the matter for a plea hearing on August 31, 2015 at 1:30pm.  A sentencing Hearing is scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.  Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Jermaine E Washington not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request an adjournment.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 08-14-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Jermaine E Washington not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request an adjournment.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Jermaine E Washington not in court, in custody.  
Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Jermaine E Washington not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a status conference date.
Case adjourned to 05-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Jermaine E Washington in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Jermaine E Washington in custody.  Ron Dauge for Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for  Bail Rewiew and Scheduling Conference in Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Faye H.; Betzalel K.; Jamie K.; Dana M.; Meloney J.; Medord R.; Pame V.; Devorah S.; Levi E. Stemach B.; Co-Defendant Matthew Owens and EW dob 11/25/98

Defendant Jermaine E Washington in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Jermaine E Washington in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised  DNA sample has not been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4)



  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
